meanings.definition: To take up and hold by either absorption or adsorption.
meanings.sent1: The sponge will sorb the water quickly.
meanings.sent2: Plants sorb nutrients from the soil to grow.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally sorbed too much soap in the dishwater!
meanings.sent4: Her mind seemed to sorb every detail of the story.
meanings.sent5: The paper towel will sorb the spilled juice in no time.

meanings.definition: A substance that has been sorbed.
meanings.sent1: The sorb in the filter traps impurities from the water.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are studying the properties of the sorb found in the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The mysterious sorb in the jar turned out to be a rare mineral.
meanings.sent4: The sorb in the air freshener absorbs odors effectively.
meanings.sent5: The sorb in the cleaning solution makes it powerful against stains.
